TextBody:
Hi Jimmy & Cooper,

I hope you are doing well.

Due to the enhancements and critical issues the R&D team has been addressing over the past few months, this has been delayed.

I'm expecting to get a response from them late December and if I hear back from them earlier than that, I'll get back to you.

Best regards,

Pasan Illege
Technical Support Engineer Tier 2 (APAC)

Anyway,this issue was reproduced in our lab as well,the thing is the display of activities on AIC was all correctly when the DEFEND’s time zone came to GMT.

Unfortunately,when the time zone was setup as GMT+8,the result became wrong.so I think we should have a call tomorrow or Friday to take a look at this.

Are you available for a session tomorrow or Friday ?

 

Jimmy

sophospsmartbannerend 

Hi Jimmy,

I asked the question about GMT time zone question and below is the response from R&D.

The activity events shown in the screenshot (Please see the attached) are showing an access time of 8/5/2024 which should also be using local time zone (GMT+8). So, the issue is that we're seeing dates in local time zone outside of the selected date range, not that the events are shown in GMT.

That's why we need TSMC's activity logs from NAM showing the actual full timestamp of the events, so we can determine when the events actually occurred and whether there's a date translation issue on the NAM side or AIC or somewhere else. 

Can you kindly provide NAM logs that are related to these events so R&D team can investigate?

Best regards,

Pasan Illege

However,this might be the work run TSMC can accepted.

 

Jimmy

Hi Pasan,

 

The true thing is AIC use GMT as default time zone, however, it don’t make sense for TSMC when using GMT as a base to do an investigation by AIC 

Anyway, not only version 11.0 ,but we also see this issue in our lab StealthAUDIT 11.5 as well and think this’s common issue of AIC

Besides ,I really don’t know and wonder why you guys or RD can’t reproduced this issue and check it out on your side.

 

At this stage,the only thing you and R&D should do is letting TSMC know why the time zone of AIC is GMT,not GMT+8.

 

Please noticed and reply for this question and looking forward to hearing from you.

 

After that,when this issue can be sorted it out.That all.

 

@georges.chahwan@netwrix.com

Hi Jimmy, R&D reviewed the logs shared and what Cooper reproduced is not the same issue that TSMC is seeing. What Cooper reproduced is related to the fact that the date range query in AIC queries 

	Caution! This message was sent from outside your organization.
	

sophospsmartbannerend 

Hi Jimmy,

R&D reviewed the logs shared and what Cooper reproduced is not the same issue that TSMC is seeing. What Cooper reproduced is related to the fact that the date range query in AIC queries all the events that fall into that range in GMT format, but then displays those events with the local timezone set on the AIC console, so it's not necessarily an issue that some events may fall slightly outside of the date range depending on the timezone of the AIC console. 

However, TSMC seems to be seeing an issue where activity events are multiple days past the applied filter, which would be a different. 
In order to diagnose that issue they really need the activity logs from TSMC containing the activity events from the date range in question. There's not really anything we can investigate without those logs. 

They would also like to point out that it looks like TSMC is still on v11.0, which is no longer supported as of April 2024. So even if they were to identify a bug here, they wouldn't be able to deliver a fix for v11.0. 

Can you please provide the logs as soon as possible from the customer environment so I can get R&D team to review and provide response?

Best regards,

Pasan Illege
Technical Support Engineer Tier 2 (APAC)
